intro: Crataegus cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf hawthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically 2–6 inches long and have a serrated edge. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers in the spring, followed by red or orange berries in the fall. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Crataegus cordifolia is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
